text:
An Off-Duty Cop Fired His Gun During a Confrontation With Teens 
The boy in this video is 13 years old. Most Popular By Sammy Nickalls Feb 22, 2017 A viral video appears to show an off-duty Los Angeles police officer opening fire during a physical altercation with two teenage boys. Man claiming to be police officer grabs young Chicano kid violently and eventually pulls gun out & shoots at kids. Anaheim, Ca 2/21/17 pic.twitter.com/UhMQMsuE1t 
— Marina (@oxminaox) February 22, 2017 Advertisement - Continue Reading Below KTLA 5 reports that the incident happened in Anaheim on Tuesday afternoon, and one of the teens was arrested for making criminal threats and battery, while the other was arrested for assault and battery. The LAPD officer, however, was not arrested. Luckily, no one was physically harmed. "[A] 13-year-old male is alleged to have made a threat to the off-duty officer that he was going to shoot him," Sgt. Daron Wyatt with the Anaheim Police Department told ABC 7 . Most Popular Here's video of what happens leading up to the off-duty Anaheim officer grabbing the child. All bc a girl walked on the lawn. Ridiculous! pic.twitter.com/fnbfSJFUgd 
— Marina (@oxminaox) February 23, 2017 However, the teen's mother, who asked ABC 7 not to identify her, said otherwise: 
"In reality he was saying, 'I'm going to sue you. You keep hitting me. You're hurting me. I'm going to sue you.'...I didn't see him being aggressive. I saw him remaining as calm as he possibly could. I saw him trying to reason with the adult." In videos tweeted by Twitter user @oxminaox , the teen can be heard telling the police officer that he made an offensive comment to his female friend: 
"I didn't do anything to hurt you. All I said was to respect the girl. You told her to 'get off my property you freakin' c***."
